title: Great Yarmouth: 'This town got stuck in time but now I'm loving it'
description: Great Yarmouth is turning its fortunes round with an increase in visitors and several big projects.

title: The experiences replacing closed High Street stores
description: Go-karts, bowling alleys and eateries have taken the place of closed retailers on the High Street.

title: Female military staff denied justice by inadequate system - MPs
description: Veterans describe a "boys' club" where sex assaults were hushed up and complaining could be career-ending.

title: Tokyo Olympics: The youngest athletes, past and present
description: GB skateboarder Sky Brown is 13 years old, but there have been even younger in the history of the Games.

title: Excitement over wooden shipwreck found in Antigua's seabed
description: Historians believe the wreck found in Antigua to be the 1762 Beaumont, a French merchant ship.

title: From lockdown animations to Snoop Dogg music video
description: After his homemade animations went viral, Snoop Dogg asked Peter Quinn to direct his new video.

title: 'You'd walk out if your husband hit you - you can't when it's your child'
description: Parenting a violent child is a traumatic experience, and one that is often hidden from view.

title: Budapest Pride stands up for LGBT rights in Hungary
description: Organisers accuse Hungary's right-wing government of seeking to discriminate against gay people.

title: Clashes in Paris over Covid measures
description: French anti-riot police fired tear gas during protests against Covid-19 curbs and vaccination.

title: Cars towed for 'dangerous' parking in Snowdonia
description: Authorities are trying to avoid a repeat of summer 2020, when hundreds of cars obstructed roads.

title: Tokyo Olympics: BBC TV schedule, radio and online coverage - times and channels
description: Full listings and coverage channels for the Tokyo Olympics across BBC TV, BBC iPlayer, BBC radio and online.

title: Goole WW2 bomb: Army experts carry out controlled explosion
description: A live Word War Two bomb, unearthed by builders on a housing development, has been destroyed in a controlled explosion.

title: The black immigrant who challenged US segregation - nearly 190 years ago
description: A black Brazilian immigrant was the first person in US history to challenge segregation in a courtroom

title: Lightning strikes and storms follow UK heatwave
description: Days of high summer temperatures give way to storms.

title: Covid vaccine: Gareth Southgate urges young people to get jab
description: The England manager says vaccination is a chance to "get your freedom back".

title: Olympic women's football: Team GB beat Japan to qualify for knockout stages
description: Great Britain guarantee their progress to the knockout stages of the Olympic women's football competition with victory over hosts Japan in Sapporo.

title: British and Irish Lions 2021: Injured prop Wyn Jones replaced by Rory Sutherland against South Africa
description: Injured British and Irish Lions prop Wyn Jones is ruled out of Saturday's first Test against South Africa, with Scotland's Rory Sutherland starting and Mako Vunipola of England added to the bench.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Adam Peaty eases through to 100m breaststroke semi-finals
description: Britain's world record holder and defending Olympic champion Adam Peaty qualifies for the semi-finals of the men's 100m breaststroke.

title: GB's Thomas crashes as Carapaz wins road race gold
description: Geraint Thomas' medal hopes are dashed during fall in the men's road race as Ecuador's Richard Carapaz wins gold.

title: Daily tests not self-isolation for police, fire, borders, transport and freight staff
description: Police, fire, borders and transport staff are now eligible in England, with 200 new test centres promised.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Adam Peaty reaches 100m breaststroke semi-final for GB
description: Britain's Adam Peaty continues his seven-year unbeaten streak in the 100m breaststroke by winning his qualifying heat with a time of 57.56 seconds.

title: Lightning destroys roofs as storms end heatwave in southern England and Wales
description: Southern Britain is hit by torrential rain but there's a sunny start to school holidays further north.

title: GB's defending champion Whitlock set to make pommel final
description: Great Britain's defending champion Max Whitlock reaches the pommel horse final at the Tokyo Olympics with a score of 14.900.

title: Ward scores on Olympic return as GB men win hockey opener
description: Great Britain's Sam Ward makes a dream return to Olympic action with a goal, 20 months after a serious eye injury.

title: Open water: Swimmers urged not to take chances
description: It is thought 28 people have lost their lives in open water during the recent hot weather.

title: Man Utd manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer signs new deal until 2024
description: Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer signs a new deal with the club until 2024, with an option for a further year.

title: Esther Dingley: Partner informed of 'remains' find in Pyrenees
description: Esther Dingley disappeared on a solo walk near the France-Spain border in November.

title: Goole WW2 bomb: M62 closed as Army prepares to detonate device
description: Army bomb experts will carry out a controlled explosion of the device, found on a new housing estate.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Helen Glover and Polly Swann into semi-finals, Andy Murray and Joe Salisbury win
description: A shaky start for Helen Glover and Polly Swann but Andy Murray and Joe Salisbury win doubles opener.

title: The young imam using Instagram to change opinions
description: Sabah Ahmedi wants to show imams can "have a laugh", have "a bit of banter" and "wear colourful socks".

title: Surfside tower collapse: No sign of final victim as Miami search ends
description: As the search for remains in the collapsed apartment block ends, one victim remains unaccounted for.

title: Australia Covid: Arrests at anti-lockdown protests
description: Thousands take to the streets in Sydney, with further protests in Melbourne and Brisbane.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Table tennis 12-year-old Hend Zaza, gymnast Zou Jingyuan and 3x3 basketball - best moments
description: Watch some of the best moments from the opening events of the Tokyo Olympics including a 12-year-old table tennis player and debut of 3x3 basketball.

title: Tokyo Olympics: First gold of Games goes to China's Yang Qian in shooting
description: Chinese shooter Yang Qian wins the first gold of the Olympics but has to sing her anthem behind a mask and hang her own medal round her neck.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Syria's Hend Zaza, 12, is out, but hopes to inspire others
description: Youngest Olympian Hend Zaza, the 12-year-old Syrian table tennis star, wants to inspire others despite losing 4-0 in the preliminary round.

title: Escape to Victory: The Ipswich footballers who made a cult classic
description: How did a group of Ipswich Town players end up starring in a film with Pele, Stallone and Caine?

title: Clubbing and Covid passports: 'Protect vulnerable people' or 'against civil liberties'?
description: Radio 1 Newsbeat chats to clubbers about having to have two jabs to go clubbing.

title: Latitude festival: Magical, emotional... and a little bit frightening
description: Bands and fans describe the atmosphere at the UK's first full-capacity festival since 2019.
